body.p: Tryptophan is an essential amino acid which is used in proteins and in amino acid derived hormones. The structure is important, but for now we will focus on the atoms involved. The molecular formula is C11H12N2O2
From the truncated periodic table above, which of the atoms in tryotophan is the most electronegative?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Carbon is in the middle of the electronegativity scale.
Incorrect. Hydrogen doesn’t “hold” its electron very tightly, making it less electronegative.
Incorrect. Nitrogen is more electronegative than carbon, but less than oxygen.
Correct. Oxygen is the most electronegative atom in tryptophan. Fluorine is even more electronegative (it really wants to fill that outer shell), but F is not in tryptophan.

hint.p: The periodic table image above shows that the farther to the right, the more electronegative the element.
